basics.name: Ann Allan
basics.label: Full Stack Web Developer
basics.summary: After my 2 years of Army service. I earned a degree in Theater and spent 16 years working my way up through the ranks of production and administration.  A few years back I attained the position of Production Manager and, for a while, Interim Managing Director for a regional theater company in DC.  As my passion for coding grew, the time felt right to take on the new challenge of making it a career. In my spare time I enjoy adding new technologies to my skill set. I also enjoy swing dancing, sports, crafts, hiking, baking, and escape rooms.

work.summary: Built several fully developed and deployed web apps such as Personal Website, Dating App, Facebook Clone, and Online Retailer

Responsible for overseeing all elements of production including budgeting, hiring, scheduling, touring, and season planning. Point of contact for all information about each production and special event. Additional Responsibilities included direct supervision of production assistants and interns as well as supervision of Rentals Associate to ensure customer satisfaction and achievement of revenue goals and supervision of Facilities Coordinator to ensure compliance with all industry standards and safety requirements.
highlights: Developed and streamlined process for hiring and contract management to make it faster, more consistent, and less error-prone
Successfully coordinated all details for touring production to Juarez and Chihuahua, Mexico for Festival Internacional Chihuahua
Improved company's venue and equipment management to allow for increased revenue and patronage from rental events

work.summary: Responsible for overseeing all aspects of lighting department for Production, Rentals, and Facilities. Tasks include hiring of lighting personnel and ensuring payroll paperwork processed, maintaining lighting equipment and stock, managing department budgets, providing lateral service to other departments including Marketing, Development, and Rentals.
highlights: Researched building electrical layout to accommodate increasing power needs and prevent overload.
Researched and implemented "Green" procedures and equipment with respect to energy consumption.
Increased potential for rental revenue by designing lighting package options to offer clients

work.summary: Cirkus Smirkus, Shakespeare Theater Company, GALA Hispanic Theater, American Family Theater, Tennessee Performing Arts Center, Opryland Hotel, Vanderbilt University
highlights: Production Stage Manager, Stage Manager, Assistant Stage Manager
Master Carpenter, Carpenter, Sound Engineer, Wardrobe Manager

volunteer.summary: PittStop welcomes dancers of all ages and experience to a high-energy weekend of swing dancing with 30 hours of music and dancing fun!
Personal Contribution: producing 100 sets of mittens and hats for the homeless each year

skills.name: Excellent oral and written communication skills
Leadership and Organizational Skills developed during 2+ years of US Army Service
